titlestmt.titleproper: Jebsen Center for Counter Terrorism Studies RecordsUA153

did.unittitle: Jebsen Center for Counter Terrorism Studies Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Jebsen Center for Counter Terrorism Studies

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into seven series: Student research and proposals; Grant proposals and information; Administrative files; Courses; Conferences; Website; and Unprocessed accessions.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection processed by Zachary Yontz, supervised by Veronica Martzahl.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes reports, presentations, publications, websites, and other documentation relating to the functions of the Jebsen Center for Counter Terrorism Studies.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Jebsen Center for Counter-Terrorism Studies was established at The Fletcher School in September, 2005 with a gift by Mr. Jan Henrik Jebsen, Chairman of the Gamma Applied Visions Group, a Swiss holding company. The Center was led by Director Brigadier General (retired) Russell Howard, Associate Director Paula Broadwell, Associate Director Stacy Neal, and Staff Assistant Jeannine Lenehan. Its mission was to increase the understanding and competency of counter-terrorism professionals. To accomplish this mission the Jebsen Center funded a robust research and analysis program, hosted conferences and a visiting fellows program, and conducted outreach activities. The early research topics at the Center focused on predicting, preventing and preempting terrorist activity, as well as understanding the role of women and business in the campaign against terrorism. The Jebsen Center closed in September 2008.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

controlaccess.subject: Curriculum and Instruction -- Academic Centers and Institutes
Foreign affairs
Curriculum and Instruction -- Student Work

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains original notes, reports, publications, and correspondence created by graduate students at the Jebsen Center for Counter Terrorism Studies. Includes work done by students for publication and work done towards earning grants, funding, internships, and fellowships. Student curriculum vitaes are also present in most folders. Also contains student proposals for studies and research that were rejected.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains original research, proposals and correspondence between the Jebsen Center for Counter Terrorism Studies and funding institutions. The proposals were created to generate grant funding for research within the Jebsen Center on topics dealing with terrorism and counter-terrorism. Correspondance is between the Jebsen Center and funding institutions regarding fund payments and the status of research. There is also research done by the Jebsen Center on potential funding institutions.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 20 years from date of creation. Open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folders containing files that were not compatible with preservation formats: ProTechT has regular PDFs, .jpg, and .wmv files; Synexxus has PDFs; Foundations has PDFs; Bradley Foundation has PDFs; Fletcher Policy has .jpg and .htm; Human Security and Terrorism has PDFs; JHJ has .jpg; Luce Foundation has .eml; Madrasas has .htm and PDFs; PERSEREC has PDFs, .css, .gif, and .js; PV3103 has .jpg; Sloan Foundation has PDFs, .mdi; Transnational Crime has PDFs, .xfd; TSWG has PDFs; U.S. Muslims Diaspora has PDFs and .xfs; Tufts Paperwork has PDFs and .eml

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains weekly activity reports and financial reports for the Jebsen Center for Counter Terrorism Studies between 2005 and 2008. The activity reports track the work and progress of staff members, researchers, and student fellows. Financial reports deal with the allocation of funds for salaries, wages, travel, and research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains schedules and syllabi for Executive Education courses, Professional Development and Training courses, and seminars offered by the Jebsen Center for Counter Terrorism Studies. Many of the courses offered were one day or one week intensive courses taught by the director of the Jebsen Center, BG (Ret.) Russell D. Howard. The series also contains information on proposed courses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains reports, correspondence, and financial records pertaining to the inaugural conference for the opening of the Jebsen Center for Counter Terrorism Studies as well as conferences on terrorism and counter terrorism studies held by the Jebsen Center. The series also contains information on potential guest speakers for the conferences. The conferences are largely based on Jebsen Center-generated research. Some of the conferences have been recorded and preserved on DVD.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains PDF files of articles originally posted to the Jebsen Center for Counter Terrorism Studies website, including articles generated by Fletcher School and Jebsen Center graduate students. The articles are largely about work that was done in the field of counter terrorism by the Jebsen Center.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged as received.
